Erik Reinertsen     Blog     Research     Tech     Teaching     Talks

I aspire to be a great teacher of both medicine and engineering.

At Georgia Tech I TA’d two semesters of computational systems biology. We covered linear algebra, differential equations, graph theory, probabilistic models, parameter estimation, and metabolomics. Here are my teaching evaluations from Fall 2015 and Spring 2016.

I wrote “Tips for TAing” and “How to give a great chalk talk”.

At Emory I helped start the Medical Student Teaching Competition.

At UCLA I tutored undergraduate engineering students for two years.
